refnamediv.refpurpose: Generic manual page for device drivers.

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: RTS2 uses device drivers to communicate with various available hardware. Device drivers are stand-alone binaries. They connect to RTS2 system using TCP/IP connection, and register to the system. They also know how to talk to different supported devices, and transfer RTS2 command and variables to those devices commmands and variables. Last, but not least, they provide RTS2 with messages about their functionality and status.

This manual page document generic devices options. To see devices options please consult man pages for generic devices (rts2-camd, ..) and man pages for specific devices (rts2-camd-fli,..). See links bellow for help in finding those informations.

refsect1.title: OPTIONS
refsect1.para: RTS2 follows the usual &gnu; command line syntax, with long options starting with two dashes (`--'). A summary of options is included below.

listitem.para: Set device name. Device name is used as prefix for all values. If not specified, default device name will be used. Device names must be unique inside RTS2 system.

The best way how to specify device names is through devices configuration file - see
rts2.devices 5
for details.
Run in interactive mode. Program is not deamonized, and all log messages are printed to standart output.
Specify local port which device will use to accept new requests.

Specify localhost name. This options is rarely used when network is not configured properly, and the user cannot change how network is configured. Together with --local-port it can be used to run RTS2 through tunnels.

Specify modefile. Modefiles are used to set different device modes. They contains name of modes, followed by list of variables and desired values. They are used to quickly change between different device modes.

Specify name of the host and possibly port, which runs rts2-centrald1. This option is needed only for setups that use multiple computers. Its default is localhost for hostname and 617 for port number. If only hostname is provided, default port number - 617 - is used. Default will work for simple setups.
